Passionate about building real-world solutions, I am driven to innovate at the intersection of robotics, AI, and simulation technologies.

Snack Delivering Trailbot

  • Hardware Integration: Integrated LiDAR, IMU, camera, servos with the Husky AGV platform. Performed LiDAR and camera pose calibration.
  • Servo Control Development: Designed and implemented a servo control service using micro-ROS on Arduino Due for smooth snack dispensing.
  • SLAM Tuning and Sensor Fusion: Optimized Cartographer SLAM with 3D LiDAR and IMU data over a set outdoor trail environment tests.
  • Human Detection and Tracking: Deployed YOLOv7 for human detection for real-time tracking and safe robot-human interactions.
  • Trail-Aware Navigation: Developed a navigation commander node based on real-time trail segmentation using a Lightweight Encoder-Decoder Architecture. Trained the architecture on custom labeled trail environments.
  • State Machine Implementation: Designed a robust state machine to coordinate all system components, enabling adaptive decision-making for navigation, human interaction, and dispensing tasks.
Python embedded C ROS SLAM Computer Vision Solidworks System Design

Project title

  • Designed a PID position and attitude controller for the Crazyflie drone with manually tuned gains.
  • Implemented RRT* path planning with node filtering to reduce computational complexity and improve path efficiency.
  • Used PCHIP spline interpolation to generate second-order smooth trajectories with continuous velocity and acceleration profiles.
  • Simulated the drone maneuvers in PyBullet simulator
  • Deployed the controller on the Crazyflie firmware for real-time autonomous navigation and control.
Python Pybullet RRT* PID Control

Terrain Traversability Mapping

  • Developed a C++ costmap plugin for Navigation2. The plugin generates costmaps using terrain traversability constraints, improving path planning over rough terrains.
  • Implemented a Kalman filter-based map fusion algorithm to refine height estimates of the terrain. This improved costmap accuracy and enhanced navigation safety.
  • Created a real-time terrain structure visualization plugin for RViz. Utilized OGRE3D and custom ROS message types to render detailed surface information.
  • Integrated the plugin with ROS 2 Navigation2 stack. Achieved efficient costmap updates and low-latency visualization for real-time navigation tasks.
ROS nav2 C++ OGRE3D

Multi Robot Planning Optimization

  • Used DAPSO to solve the multi-robot task allocation problem, ensuring optimal task distribution. For dynamic task assignment, leveraged PPO to adapt in real-time.
  • Developed a graph-based warehouse model in networkX. This model enabled efficient task allocation and smooth path planning for the robots.
  • Simulated the operation of multiple robots in Gazebo within a warehouse setup. The simulation provided insights into the performance of the task allocation and path planning algorithms.
  • Implemented the Regulated Pure Pursuit controller and adjusted its parameters for better lane-following behavior. This allowed the robots to navigate more effectively in the warehouse.
  • Integrated a collision avoidance system alongside junction preference logic. This ensured safe and efficient navigation through complex layouts with minimal conflicts.
Python Gazebo ROS Particle Swarm Optimization A* Pure Pursuit Controller

Improving Visual SLAM in Motion Blur

  • Developed a pipeline integrating deep deblurring networks with ORB SLAM3 to improve tracking accuracy in visually degraded environments affected by motion blur.
  • Designed and implemented a keypoint filtering algorithm based on blur kernel intensity to enhance feature matching and tracking in blurry frames.
  • Curated a synthetic dataset in Unity3D to simulate various blur intensities for controlled testing of deblurring and tracking performance.
  • Conducted benchmark testing on the EuROC MAV dataset, demonstrating up to 45% improvement in pose tracking accuracy with the proposed deblurring pipeline.
  • Reduced tracking loss in ORB SLAM3, achieving robust and stable pose estimation in challenging, blur-prone environments.
Visual Odometry without Deblurring (Poor tracking)
Visual Odometry with Deblurring (Good tracking performance)
C# C++ SLAM Deep Learning Blender Unity3D

Gaussian splatting enhancement with LiDAR prior

  • Improved 3DGS Representation: Enhanced the 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS) algorithm by integrating LiDAR-based depth regularization to improve scene representation for autonomous driving applications, especially in sparse data scenarios.
  • Depth Regularization Integration: Infused a depth prior into the 3DGS optimization process to improve depth estimates and scene reconstruction accuracy, mitigating issues with sparse LiDAR inputs and large scenes.
  • Dataset and Evaluation: Conducted experiments using the NuScenes dataset to compare the performance of the depth-regularized 3DGS method against the original implementation, achieving superior depth estimation and reduced artifacts in novel view synthesis.
  • Qualitative and Quantitative Improvements: Demonstrated improvements in depth accuracy and comparable RGB renders, with a notable reduction in visual artifacts during novel view synthesis.
  • 3D LiDAR Point Cloud Segmentation: Utilized depth-regularized 3DGS-rendered images for 3D LiDAR point cloud segmentation, enhancing the performance of segmentation tasks with more accurate depth information.
SfM/MVS Python CUDA Computer Vision PCL Novel view Rendering
